critique: This document amends a previous executive order related to the International Organizations Immunities Act and the Inter-American Development Bank. It clarifies that a certain designation should not affect the applicability of a specific provision in the Bank's Articles of Agreement. Given the subject matter, the document appears to have minimal impact on ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion. The changes are technical and specific to the operation of the Inter-American Development Bank.
